thread.title: North Korea calls for release of 3 detained in Kim Jong Nam case - Channel NewsAsia
thread.title_full: North Korea calls for release of 3 detained in Kim Jong Nam case - Channel NewsAsia

title: North Korea calls for release of 3 detained in Kim Jong Nam case - Channel NewsAsia
text:
Asia Pacific North Korea calls for release of 3 detained in Kim Jong Nam case The North Korean embassy in Malaysia has called for the immediate release of a Vietnamese woman, an Indonesian woman and a North Korean man detained in the connection with the murder of Kim Jong Nam. Posted 22 Feb 2017 16:09 Updated 22 Feb 2017 16:20 Indonesian Siti Aisyah (left) and Vietnamese Doan Thi Huong (right) have been detained in connection with the alleged murder of Kim Jong Un's half-brother Kim Jong Nam. (Photos: Reuters) A 
KUALA LUMPUR: The North Korean embassy in Malaysia said on Wednesday (Feb 22) that the three suspects detained in the connection with the murder of Kim Jong Nam should be immediately released. 
A Vietnamese woman, an Indonesian woman and a North Korean man have been "arrested unreasonably", the embassy said in a statement released to the media. 
Kim Jong Nam, the estranged half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, was killed at Kuala Lumpur International Airport last week while preparing to board a flight to Macau. 
Malaysian police said a senior official in the North Korean embassy and a staffer at its state airline, were also wanted for questioning over the murder. - Reuters
